Snowblower Repair ServicesAt Sears Home Services, we specialize in comprehensive repair and maintenance services for snowblowers. Our certified technicians are equipped to handle common issues such as engines not starting, augers not turning, and unusual operational noises.
Common Snowblower Issues We Repair

Engine Won't Start: Could be due to a faulty spark plug or stale fuel.
Auger Not Turning: Often caused by a broken shear pin or belt issues.
Unusual Noises During Operation: May indicate loose parts or debris in the auger housing.
Snowblower Not Throwing Snow Far Enough: Could be due to a clogged chute or worn impeller.

Our Repair Process

Initial Inspection: Thorough examination to identify issues.
Diagnosis and Cost Estimate: Transparent pricing provided before any work begins.
Repair and Testing: Repairs conducted using genuine parts, followed by performance testing.
Final Quality Check: Ensuring the snowblower operates at optimal performance.

Maintenance Tips for Snowblowers

Regular Cleaning: Keeps the machine free from snow and debris.
Proper Storage Practices: Store in a dry place to prevent rust and corrosion.
Oil and Fuel Checks: Regularly check and replace oil and use fresh fuel.
Scheduled Professional Inspections: Regular yearly professional snowblower maintenance helps identify and address issues early.

Snowblower Brands We Service
Our technicians are experienced in servicing a variety of brands, including:

Ariens.
Toro.
Honda.
Craftsman.
Husqvarna.

Ready to get your snowblower going again? Schedule repair service online now or call our service representatives at 802-552-4364.

repair service

Frequently Asked QuestionsWhat types of snow blower repairs do you offer?Sears Home Services provides repairs for a variety of snow blower issues, including broken tire chains, engine problems, loose attachments, worn belts and damaged tires. We specialize in fixing both single-stage and two-stage snow blowers.Can you repair snow blowers from any brand?Yes! We service major snow blower brands such as Ariens, Husqvarna, MTD, Murray and Craftsman, along with many others. Our team is trained to handle a wide range of snow blower repairs, regardless of the brand.What if it’s more cost-effective to replace my snow blower?If we determine that repairing your snow blower would not be cost-effective, we’ll recommend purchasing a new model instead of making unnecessary repairs. Our goal is to provide you with the best value and solution for your needs.How can I schedule a snow blower repair or maintenance?You can easily schedule a snow blower repair or maintenance service online through our website. Whether you need a repair, tune-up, or inspection, our experts are ready to help.Dependable Snow Thrower Repair and Snowblower Service from Sears Home Services
Whether you’re looking for snow blower repair or need a new snow blower, Sears Home Services can help. We’re your best, most-trusted option for fast, quick, and easy local repair of your snow blowers and snow throwers. Whether your snow blower won’t start, won’t stay on, or your snow blower auger isn’t turning, we’ll connect you to the best local snow blower service technicians in the business. Technicians that are highly trained, licensed, vetted, and guaranteed to help fix all of your snow blower repair needs.
At Sears Home Services, we want to make sure your snow blower repair service runs smoothly. In addition to our service of major brands such as Ariens and Craftsman snow blowers, our team of dedicated experts can address common problems without compromising quality. Whether you have a single stage snow blower or two-stage snow blower, we’re the team for the job.
You don’t have to worry about common snow blower problems
When you need to get mounds of snow out of the way, getting the job done quickly is essential. This is why you want to know you can count on your snow blower when the winter weather hits. With an experienced snow blower repair team, you’ll have the confidence that your snow blower is ready for anything. Some of the issues we address include:

Broken snow blower tire chains that need fixing
Snow blower engines that won’t turn over
Securing snow blower attachments that are loose
Repairing your snow blower tires

At Sears Home Services, we always act with integrity. As such, we’ll never perform a repair if we believe it’s more cost-effective to purchase a newer model. Whether you have a gas snow blower or an electric one, we’ll send out the right repair person with relevant expertise to ensure you benefit from a prompt and accurate service.
Schedule your snow blower repair service online today.
If your snow blower isn’t needing a repair, but simply a tune up or inspection, schedule snow blower maintenance with our technicians today. Or if you just need replacement parts, find snow blower parts here.

full_content.content:
Dependable Snow Thrower Repair and Snowblower Service from Sears Home Services
Whether you’re looking for snow blower repair or need a new snow blower, Sears Home Services can help. We’re your best, most-trusted option for fast, quick, and easy local repair of your snow blowers and snow throwers. Whether your snow blower won’t start, won’t stay on, or your snow blower auger isn’t turning, we’ll connect you to the best local snow blower service technicians in the business. Technicians that are highly trained, licensed, vetted, and guaranteed to help fix all of your snow blower repair needs.
At Sears Home Services, we want to make sure your snow blower repair service runs smoothly. In addition to our service of major brands such as Ariens and Craftsman snow blowers, our team of dedicated experts can address common problems without compromising quality. Whether you have a single stage snow blower or two-stage snow blower, we’re the team for the job.
You don’t have to worry about common snow blower problems
When you need to get mounds of snow out of the way, getting the job done quickly is essential. This is why you want to know you can count on your snow blower when the winter weather hits. With an experienced snow blower repair team, you’ll have the confidence that your snow blower is ready for anything. Some of the issues we address include:

Broken snow blower tire chains that need fixing
Snow blower engines that won’t turn over
Securing snow blower attachments that are loose
Repairing your snow blower tires

At Sears Home Services, we always act with integrity. As such, we’ll never perform a repair if we believe it’s more cost-effective to purchase a newer model. Whether you have a gas snow blower or an electric one, we’ll send out the right repair person with relevant expertise to ensure you benefit from a prompt and accurate service.
Schedule your snow blower repair service online today.
If your snow blower isn’t needing a repair, but simply a tune up or inspection, schedule snow blower maintenance with our technicians today. Or if you just need replacement parts, find snow blower parts here.

Sears Home Service-Snow Blower Service & Repair by BruceI have to say that this experience was very good.  I called Sears Home Service on 16 Jan 2025, around 3:30 pm to find tech to service a snow blower given to me.  Sears had an appt scheduled the next day.  The tech called this morning with his estimated time.  Bruce came in for the service.   Afterwards, he needed to test the blower outside but I forgot that I had my garage door manually tied shut.  So we removed the ties, opened the door and took the blower outside to test.  It was a good thing that we did that because he found some residual gas had gelled in the carburetor.  Once that was cleaned,  Bruce put it back, restarted and the blower ran well.  He then gave me a quick training on using it.  Once we were done,  he brought the blower back in and helped me close the garage door back up and we closed out the service ticket.  He did ask me about the warranty service and I told him that I was looking into it but was not ready at this time.  I really appreciated his time and his work on my equipment.   He even provided recommendations on some garage doors and openers.  Thank you!D J, NJJanuary 17, 2025

He then gave me a quick training on using it.  Once we were done,  he brought the blower back in and helped me close the garage door back up and we closed out the service ticket.  He did ask me about the warranty service and I told him that I was looking into it but was not ready at this time.  I really appreciated his time and his work on my equipment.   He even provided recommendations on some garage doors and openers.  Thank you!

Glossary TermsWhat is a Snowblower Auger?A snowblower auger is the spiral-shaped blade mechanism at the front of a snowblower that cuts through snow, breaking it up and directing it towards the chute for expulsion, playing a crucial role in the snow clearing process.What is the drum of the washing machine?The drum is the core part of the washer that holds your laundry and enables the cleaning process through rotation, agitation, and rinsing.What is a 608 Certification?The 608 Certification, mandated by the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA), is required for HVAC technicians to legally handle refrigerants. It ensures technicians understand refrigerant types, environmental impact, and proper handling techniques.What is a Compressor?A compressor is a mechanical device that increases the pressure of a gas by reducing its volume, essential in various systems including refrigerators, air conditioners, and HVAC units for cooling and refrigeration processes.
